clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Polidocanol is a sclerosing agent indicated to treat uncomplicated spider veins and uncomplicated reticular veins in the lower extremity

contraindications.disease: Most adverse reactions are related to the intravenous administration such as local irritation pain and hematoma Extravasation can also be an issue
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Polidocanol has a concentration and volume dependent damaging effect on the blood vessel endothelium

incompatibilities.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Peginterferon alfa 2a
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Pegfilgrastim
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Peginterferon alfa 2b
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Pegaspargase
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Pegademase
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Pegvisomant
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Propylene glycol
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Heptaethylene glycol
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Pegaptanib
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Egaptivon pegol
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with PEG uricase
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Peginterferon alfacon 1
The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with GlycoPEG GCSF

The therapeutic efficacy of Polidocanol can be decreased when used in combination with Pegpleranib
